text: Mondaire Jones (born May 18, 1987) is an American attorney and politician. He is a member of the Democratic Party. He was the U.S. Representative for from 2021 to 2023. He and Ritchie Torres were the first openly gay black members of Congress. He was the Democratic nominee for in the 2020 election. He won the election in November 2020. In August 2022, he lost re-nomination in the Democratic primaries. ==References== ==Other websites== * Campaign website Category:1987 births Category:Living people Category:African-American politicians Category:African-American lawyers Category:American political activists Category:United States representatives from New York (state) Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:LGBT people from New York City Category:Gay men Category:American LGBT politicians Category:Lawyers from New York City Category:21st-century American politicians Category:Harvard University alumni Category:LGBT African-Americans Category:LGBT lawyers Category:Stanford University alumni
title: Mondaire Jones
